versioning.note: Each service has its own version. SOAP services use separate WSDL endpoints.

api_groups.name: Item API (Product/Catalog)
api_groups.description: Create, update, and manage product listings on Rakuten Ichiba.

api_groups.name: Order API
api_groups.description: Search and retrieve orders, update order status, and manage shipping information.

api_groups.name: Inventory API
api_groups.description: Manage stock quantities per item and variant.

api_groups.name: Navigation API
api_groups.description: Access Rakuten's category tree for product classification.

auth.summary: Custom ESA authentication using Base64-encoded ServiceSecret:LicenseKey

data_format: XML (legacy APIs) and JSON (newer APIs, v2.0+)
pagination: Offset-based (page number + page size) for most list endpoints

sandbox.note: Rakuten does not provide a dedicated sandbox environment. Use production with test shop credentials. A test mode flag is available on some endpoints.
sandbox.test_shop: Create a test shop account via the Rakuten Partner Portal.

common_gotchas: Many legacy Rakuten APIs return XML even when Content-Type: application/json is requested — parse both.
Rakuten uses a custom 'ESA' auth header prefix, NOT 'Basic' or 'Bearer'.
Product pages on Rakuten are highly customized HTML — image and description fields support HTML markup.
No sandbox: test in production with a test shop. Be careful not to publish test listings publicly.
Order confirmation must be explicit — orders do NOT auto-confirm. You must call confirmOrder.
Genre (category) IDs are required for all product listings. Use the Navigation API to map your categories.
